subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Voice to Print Software Results
author: Ron Lederer
full_text:
--0-1996912418-1208365089=:88497
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Good stuff aaron.  Stefan is the expert out of the two of us here but if he gives me specific instructions I will be glad to give it a go.  Ron L

kolrone <a.cronk@...> wrote:          Margaret: Unfortunately I didn't record, which in retrospect, wasn't 
a very smart idea. I just wanted to run it, to see if it would even 
work. An issue that I noticed while doing this is that there is a lag 
time. When the program does recognize the allophones, it will show 
what it thinks was said and will wait for a "sentence" to finish. The 
problem with that is when doing that, Naturally speaking would erase 
some of what it thought was said if the allophones kept going. When I 
was listening, I think I recognized some things that the program 
didn't type down. I'll try to run a few more experiments later 
tonight when I get home from work.

LK: The session was probably maybe 10 minutes or so. The program 
didn't type down everything, so I will try to tweak it some more, 
maybe by slowing down EVPMaker. I believe it became clear longer, 
because I slowed it down to 80% or so during the session. I will 
definately trying to adjust it some more and share the results again.

Stefan/Ron L.: That definately does sound like a good idea. I will 
see if I can try that. Maybe when I get home, I will see if I can 
copy and paste the text that is supposed to be read to the group. If 
I can, anybody that can help in synthesizing the allophones to read 
the text, that would be a great help. To do that you have to have 
Adobe Audition correct? Or is there anything else you can use/build?

-Aaron
